bibl.title: Language and Literacy in Early Hellenistic Egypt.
bibl.note: What the evidence seems to be indicating is a gradual deepening of Ptolemaic rule, illustrated by the increasing use of Greek as the language of the administration.
THOMPSON Dorothy J., Language and Literacy in Early Hellenistic Egypt.
Per BILDE et alii (Edd.), Ethnicity in Hellenistic Egypt = Studies in Hellenistic Civilization. III (Aarhus, 1992) pp. 39-52.
